thread.title: Love for Sione Lauaki as ex-All Black mourned by hundreds at Auckland service
thread.title_full: Love for Sione Lauaki as ex-All Black mourned by hundreds at Auckland service

title: Love for Sione Lauaki as ex-All Black mourned by hundreds at Auckland service
text:
Love for Sione Lauaki as ex-All Black mourned by hundreds at Auckland service Last updated 11:59, February 18 2017 1 NEWS 
Wife Stephanie Lauaki tells mourners Sione "was the person we all needed him to be". 
Hundreds of mourners have gathered at Church United in Te Atatu, Auckland, to farewell former All Black Sione Lauaki. 
Lauaki, 35, died last week after suffering from renal failure and cardiovascular problems. 
The hard-hitting rugby player was a Chiefs stalwart who first won All Blacks selection in 2005. He would go on to play 17 tests for New Zealand. Lawrence Smith/ Fairfax NZ 
Sione Lauaki's wife Stephanie stands by the former All Black's casket at his funeral in West Auckland. 
Speaking at the service, wife Stephanie gave a beautiful tribute, telling mourners Sione was "the person we all needed him to be".
